comments.body: This is one of those features that is a big quality-of-life improvement but hasn't been in the game for years. Definitely should be in the game!
Yes. It should be in the game. This will significantly improve the quality of life for Minecraft.

Yes! I recently saw a YouTube video with this on and me being dumb I was like WOAH THATS AMAZING IM GONNA GO SHOW THAT TO ALL MY FRIENDS not realizing it was java only. This would be sooo useful for my world where I'm adding different themed areas and don't really want to write HALLOWEEN TOWN and FANTASY ISLANDS in the sky so when I let my friends on they know where to go
Hopefully it will come in 1.20
you can get mob heads in bedrock by exploding mobs with a charged creeper.
Player heads in Java works because of a player‚Äôs UUID. In bedrock, you don‚Äôt have a unique UUID, and your username can be changed, meaning this can‚Äôt work.
Good idea. Hopefully, they add a comment code to gets player heads just like Java version and add another head such as enderman head in Minecraft inventory.
plz yes i am making a find the button map and i cant use my head for the credits this must be made possible
Pig heads maybe one day

Java doesn't actually have that. The only mob heads available are creeper, skeleton, zombie, wither skeleton and enderdragon. The way you get other mob heads in Java is through mods. And the way you get player heads in Java is through either mods or commands. I do really think you should be able to get any mob head by blowing them up with a charged creeper (Which is the standard method we currently use).

I didnt k ow what category this belonged in, so I just chose parity.

Honestly, I agree. Bedrock is missing various features compared to Java, such as offhand items, UI, not being able to go back to previous versions, enchantments, hardcore and spectator mode, and even little features like achievements being different. 

Mojang has stated in the past that they would like to make Java Edition and Bedrock Edition similar almost to the point you can't tell the difference, however technical and coding differences makes this process slow.

I'd love to see this happen, and it's something I wish Mojang put more priority into, it would end a lot of arguments.

I personally agree with it.
However, there is one parity that is not possible in Java and Bedrock.
In Java, baby dolphins are included in "Rejected" of "Minecraft's Suggestion Box".
In Bedrock, Spectral arrow and Glowing cannot express light emission due to the engine.
Other than that, even if it becomes "Works As Intended" etc., I would like to eliminate parity as much as possible by voting here and expressing dissenting opinions on the bug tracker.
I my gosh I think 1.20 should focus on Parity, logistics and graphics aswell
God dev

There is a reason why Axes do less damage than swords in Bedrock Edition

In the 1.9 Update for Java, cooldowns were introduced to weaponry, to make up for this change, Swords have a special enchantment called Sweeping Edge, this does damage in an arc around the player damaging multiple entities, while Axes on the other hand, do huge damage but have long cooldown times

In the 1.9 Update for Bedrock, this change was not made, because there is no cooldowns and no sweeping edge enchantment for swords on Bedrock, this change was unessential. Hope this helped
There are currently people working on the Combat Update V2, which will revamp combat for all versions.

i think it would be good to add the extra damge on the axe because it's not right to make java player's life easier when there is almost nothing free in minecraft bedrock, and its the most played version.if you think there are only kids, then add a COMPLETE tutorial so people know a bit better, like in xbox 360 edition. This would be so nice. I can‚Äôt put villagers in my base area because they link to the wrong station. I have to have them 100 blocks from everything g to have them link correctly. Please fix this, it would be so nice.

I tried making a library for easy access to enchantments, tried grouping the villagers behind walls by enchantment type (ie: armor or tools). ultimately even though I moved each villager in individually, giving it a bed and a workstation in the area I wanted it, it'd unlink to the workstation anytime I reload the area leading to endless frustration.

I concur. It would be so much easier to get more shulker shells and not waste end chunks for no other purpose other than for some really obscure farm that it‚Äôll be hard to track down.

I wish people would up vote more. I think it's arguably one of the most important farms in the game. It makes no sense to me that they did it on java but not bedrock, and yet claim to be striving for parity. For serious mid to end game technical players it's one of the most important farms. It's easy to mine out shulkers and shulkers of blocks for a variety of reasons, such as, slime farm creation, general mining, teraforming, etc... Being able to have more shulker boxs allows for shulker loaders/unloaders for upgraded storage systems to become more densely packed, but also allows you to not waste time moving items yourself and in so doing, makes things completely automated. Additionally, more shulker boxes allows better organization for more items for bigger projects. For example, you can collect all the resources you need for bigger farms, technical builds, or just general big builds, or just automatically load farm drops into shulker boxes for convenience and more densely packed storage. It's a win win win. PLEASE TAKE THIS MORE SERIOUSLY MOJANG/MICROSOFT!!!
Well, we can get resource packs... but it's not easy, and limited if you're on mobile devices.
theres are already "kind of" shaders on bedrock, but they are resource packs tho

I'd love for this to happen, but as the growing backlog of parity issues between both versions and new stuff added in big updates like the nether or the upcoming caves and cliffs update, the parity is gonna continue to grow, with what seems like no end in sight.
I think we should share this as much as possible

I think this world be quite good because if you wanted to make a survival world in the nether you could still get the achievements but it not effect any other one, but if you were to still go into creative in a world it would then turn them off.

i think 'advanced combat (1.9)' should be in a server's settings - not a player's - for the reason that it would not be fair if a person playing the old combat system fights someone with the new combat system. otherwise completely agree.

As much as I wish this would happen I don‚Äôt think they would be able to make a ‚Äúcode translator‚Äù as the games use completely different rendering engines. This would mean that most visual effects can‚Äôt just be translated. If they somehow did manage to make it  then multiplayer might be a little slow as the code would have to be translated which would add delay. The RTX on Java probs won‚Äôt happen as nvidia did most of the technical stuff behind that feature and they would have to completely recode that system for Java as Java uses a different rendering engine. Translating code comes with many bugs and the translated solution may not be the most optimum one. Java mods can‚Äôt just be converted to c++ to work on bedrock as the rendering engine and most fundamental mechanics don‚Äôt work the same and those would have to be redone to make that work and mojang isn‚Äôt going to pour this much time and energy for the sake of parity

Things in bedrock aren't the same in Java. Redstone is different. There's no bossbars in bedrock for raids. Just look at this entire parity page and you'll notice that.

"don't think this is possible even if they put the java stuff is in bedrock and the bedrock stuff in java"

The poster just said that GeyserMC enables the ability of crossplay so this is NOT impossible and GeyserMC does work. If GeyserMC can do it, Mojang definitely can and give total parity between Bedrock and Java, excluding the UI and textures but including the many things Java has that Bedrock doesn't.
Even if Java and Bedrock play on the same server, Java can put any item into their offhand, while Bedrock cannot, even if a Bedrock player is next to a Java Player.

Dear Minecraft Development Team,
First of all, thank you for creating such an amazing and creative game that connects millions of players worldwide.
I am writing to kindly request that you consider implementing crossplay functionality between the Minecraft Java Edition and Bedrock Edition. Many players, including myself, would love to be able to play together regardless of the platform they use, whether it‚Äôs PC (Java Edition), mobile, or consoles (Bedrock Edition).
Crossplay would greatly enhance the Minecraft community by allowing friends to play together more easily and unify the player base. I understand there are technical challenges, but I believe it would be a wonderful step forward for the game‚Äôs future.
Thank you for your time and for considering this request. I hope to see this feature in the near future.
Best regards,
I agree, especially for finding out if I am stuck in a block or crawling. Plus, the paper doll just feels fun to have.
It's something that only console games have. For example, Half-Life: Decay had a little icon that displays your pose just like the paper doll in Bedrock.

This idea would be perfect for Java since you don't have to open the debug menu and see your angle when you're flying in the end since you can see where you're facing in the the end, especially flying from the main island to the outer islands without falling into the void and dying.

Yeah, As a Bedrock player I find the Paper Doll very useful. I can easily check on what armor I'm wearing without pressing the inventory button or "change person view" button but can easily crouch or jump to check the armor I'm wearing.
